Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In November 2023 youth did not receive their medication due to
the facility running out of medications.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/1/2024.
Complainant did not have any other information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024. Youth A has been at the facility for approximately seven
months. Youth A takes medications and reported he is aware of
the medications he is supposed to receive in the morning and at
night. Youth A reported there has never been any issues with his
medication not being at the facility. Youth A reported he is always
given his medications and he never refuses his medications.
Youth A reported he has never had any issues with his Focalin not
being at the facility for him to take that he can recall. Youth A
reported he received all of his medications in November 2023 as
prescribed.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024. Youth B reported he takes medications in the morning,
at noon, and at night at the facility. Youth B reported he gets his
medications daily as he is prescribed. Youth B reported when he
meets with the Psychiatrist, and she prescribes a new medication
it takes a few days for the facility to receive the medications from
the pharmacy. In December 2023 Youth B was prescribed a new
dose of medication and it took two days for the new dose of
Adderall to arrive at the facility. Youth B reported that was the
only time he did not have his medication. Youth B reported he
always receives his medications at the time prescribed. Youth B
reported there was one time he was on an off grounds activity and
did not return in time to receive his medications in the time frame.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024. Youth C reported he takes medications at the facility.
Youth C reported the only time he has not received his
medications at the facility is when he is prescribed a new dose of
medication or a new medication from the Psychiatrist and it takes
2

a few days for the medication to be approved and arrive at the
facility from the pharmacy. Youth C reported he has refused
medications at the facility when he is mad. Youth C reported he
does not refuse medications often. Youth C did not have any
other concerns with receiving his medications.
Youth D was interviewed via teams on 2/13/2024. Youth D
reported he is prescribed daily medications at the facility. Youth D
reported one of his prescribed medications was to be given at
2pm however staff continued to forget to pass the medication, so
the time was changed to have the medication passed at 12pm.
Youth D did not have any other concerns regarding his
medications.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024 and via telephone 2/6/2024. Administrator 1 reported
he was made aware of Youth B and Youth C not receiving their
medications in November/December for a few days due to an
issue with the pharmacy trying to get in contact with Psychiatrist
and the Psychiatrist not returning the telephone call to the
pharmacy. Administrator 1 advised the Nurse to work to resolve
the issue. Administrator 1 reported Nurse notified him via
telephone text message that the pharmacy did not have a
prescription from Psychiatrist. Nurse addressed the issue, and it
was resolved in three days. The issue was the Psychiatrist said
they called in the prescription and the pharmacy was saying they
did not receive the prescription. Psychiatrist was contacted
however did not return the call right away. Psychiatrist, once able
to be reached, sent the prescription to the pharmacy.
Administrator 1 reported the facility has not had issues with
medications with the pharmacy, there have been some issues he
is aware of with staff not passing medication and he addressed
those concerns internally with staff discipline. Administrator 1
looked further into the medication administration record (MAR)
and reported he has found an issue with staff sending medications
on outings and he will be addressing that with staff. Administrator
1 reported the facility has been in contact with Psychiatrist’s
supervisor to address concerns of not returning phone calls timely
and the facility is exploring other options for psychiatric services.
Administrator 1 reported he was aware of an issue with
medication not being available through the pharmacy due to a
shortage and he reached out to other pharmacies to confirm this
and attempt other avenues to get the medication filled however all
pharmacy’s he spoke to were unable to fill the prescription due to
outage.
3

Administrator 2 was interviewed via teams on 2/9/2024.
Administrator 2 reported the only medications concerns in
November 2023 at the facility was addressed through staff write
ups regarding Youth D. Administrator 2 reported there were some
changes with the facility moving to Advanced Specialty RX as
their pharmacy of use, however Administrator 2 could not recall
any specific concerns. Administrator 2 reported she feels staff
could document in the electronic MAR better in the notes section
when they are selecting the option of medication not available on
cart or refuse. Administrator 2 reported she thinks when it is
documented in the MAR that the medication was not available on
cart, yet the youth had the medication earlier in the day or later in
the day, that staff are not locating the correct package or not
confident enough to dispense the same medication that may
indicate it is to be given at a different time. Many times, the
medication is on the cart, and it is not being documented
accurately.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024
and via teams on 2/9/2024. Nurse reported she returned to
working at the facility on November 1, 2023, and the facility began
using a new pharmacy service around November 8, 2023. Nurse
went through all youth medication and reconciled medications.
Nurse reported there were no issues in November with youth not
receiving medications at the facility due to the facility not having
the medications on site. The new pharmacy utilizes an electronic
MAR and there has been learning curves with the new system
such as the system was not allowing a medication to be given in
the hour timeframe, it was noting in the system the medication
was being given late. Nurse worked with the pharmacy, and it
was corrected in December. Another learning curve with the new
system was over the counter standing medications were showing
in the electronic MAR as an exception and was generating an
email saying there was a medication issue. Nurse worked to get
this issue addressed. Nurse reported there were no known issues
that she was aware of with Youth B receiving his medications in
November 2023. There was an issue with Youth B’s medication
on December 4, 5, and 6th due to Psychiatrist not refilling the
prescription with the pharmacy. Nurse reported there was an
issue with Youth A and Youth B’s Focalin as the medication was
not available as the pharmacy did not have it. Nurse reported per
looking at the electronic MAR Youth C shows “medication not in
cart” for a few days for his Loratadine however this appears to be
coded incorrectly by staff as Youth C had his medication one day
and then there was inconsistencies where the MAR shows it was
given and then “medication not in cart” which would not have been
4

possible as the medications were coming in the strip package at
that time. Nurse reported the MAR for Youth C documents
Loratadine “medication not in cart” for 11/20/2023-11/30/2023
however this was not accurate. Youth C’s Loratadine was
available as the delivery manifest shows Youth C’s Loratadine
was delivered on 11/2/2023 with 30 pills. Nurse reported when
staff are taking youth off grounds for outings, an email is sent with
the youth that will be going and Nurse checks to see if
medications need to be sent with the supervisor and sends the
medications. When medications are dispensed while on an
outing, the MAR does not reflect anything different, it just shows
the medication was given.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024.
Staff 1 has passed medications at the facility for approximately
four years. Staff 1 reported no knowledge of any issues with the
facility not receiving medications from the pharmacy. Youth C has
had situations where medications are changed by the Psychiatrist,
and it takes one to two days for the new medication/dose to arrive
at the facility after his doctor appointments. Staff 1 has never been
written up for any medication errors. The facility changed to a
different pharmacy company and initially the medications were
coming in a strip pack verses blister pack however they now are
coming in blister packs. Staff 1 reported if a medication is not on
the medication cart staff document that in the electronic MAR by
choosing the drop-down box “medication not in cart”. Staff 1
reported no concerns with medications at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024.
Staff 2 reported she was not aware or could not recall the facility
having any issues with medication in November/ December. Staff
2 reported Youth D had a few missed medications due to staff
errors and Staff 3 received a write up and suspension for the
missed medications. Staff 2 did not have any knowledge of Youth
A, Youth B, or Youth C not having medication in November/
December. There have been pharmacy issues when the
Psychiatrist writes a new prescription and discontinues the old
prescription as the Psychiatrist notifies the pharmacy and the
pharmacy makes the changes right away in the electronic MAR
however the issue was the change was being made prior to the
new medication being filled and sent to the facility by the
pharmacy. Staff 2 reported this occurred for approximately a
month however the facility has met with the pharmacy to address
the concern, and this is no longer occurring. Staff 2 did not know
how long it takes from a new prescription being sent to the
pharmacy until the facility receives the medication. Staff 2
5

recalled there was an issue where the pharmacy did not have a
medication however Staff 2 did not have all the details of the
medication and the youth who it impacted. Staff 2 reported
supervisors on shift pass medication and if needed, Staff 2 steps
in and passes medications occasionally. Staff 2 reported the
facility does not have many medication errors.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024.
Staff 3 passes medication when he is covering a supervisor’s role
on shift. Staff 3 reported he is aware of medication concerns as
supervisors report to him and would inform him of any concerns
regarding medications. Supervisor 3 was not aware of any
medication concerns for Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, or any youth
at the facility in November 2023. Staff 3 reported the facility
changed pharmacies in November/ early December 2023. When
the facility changed pharmacies there was a learning curve as
medications had always been provided in blister packs and the
new pharmacy provided medications in a packaged strip however
this was nothing that resulted in any issues with medications being
passed. Staff 3 reported he was written up for a medication error
that was with Youth D however he did not have any other
knowledge of youth not receiving their medication.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/12/2024. Staff 4
reported in November the facility changed pharmacy providers
and for a short time the medications were coming in prepacked
strip packaging. Staff 4 reported there were concerns with not all
the youth’s medications being packaged correctly as there were
missing pills in the packaging. Staff 4 was unable to provide any
specific youth impacted by this. Staff 4 indicated the situation was
rectified quickly as the facility went back to the previously used
pharmacy.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams on 2/13/2024. Staff 5 did not
have any concerns with youth receiving medications at the facility
in November 2023. The facility recently changed pharmacy
providers from Pharmascript to Advanced Specialty RX. When
the change occurred, medications changed from coming in blister
packs to arriving in strip packaging where the medication was
packaged together with a label indicating the medication date and
time to be dispensed. Staff 5 did not recall any concerns with the
medications not being properly packaged, and indicated to his
knowledge all the prescribed medications for the youth at the
indicated time were in the package. In early December 2023
there were a few youth, however Staff 5 did not recall specifically
who or what medications, who had prescriptions on the MAR that
6

had not arrived at the facility yet. Staff 5 did not know why the
medications had not arrived at the facility. Staff 5 reported he has
never received discipline for issues with administering
medications. Consultant reviewed the discipline that the facility
provided for Staff 5. Staff 5 reported he never received the
discipline and had no idea he missed giving Youth D his
medication on 11/12/2023.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services (WHS) Medication Control
Administration Policy and Site Protocols Policy: WHS
prohibits dispense prescription medication without a
prescription or dispensing one client’s prescription
medication to any other youth. Designated personnel will
contact Pharmacy to notify them of new intakes.
Information will include name, date of birth, date of entry,
allergies, site location, medication, dosage, and
administration times. Pharmacy will create a new
electronic record for client. Health services personnel will
obtain new prescriptions from physicians to ensure
continuation of any medication. Staff are to make sure all
proper documentation is completed each and every time
medication is given.
• Wolverine Human Services Attendance Record for
Clarence Fischer House from 11/1/2023-11/30/2023.
• Youth A MAR for November 2023: Guanfacine Tab 1 mg
ER is documented as medication not available in
medication cart on 11/5, 11/6, and 11/7. On 11/10 and
11/23 the MAR was left blank. Aripiprazole Tab 15 mg 11/6,
11/7, 11/11, 11/12, 11/13, 11/14, 11/15, 11/16, 11/17, 11/18
are documented as medication not available in medication
cart on 11/19 it is documented as refused, 11/20, 11/21,
11/22 are documented as medication not available in
medication cart. Dexmethylph CAP 15 mg ER is
documented as medication not available in medication cart
on 11/11, 11/12, 11/13, and 11/14. This documentation is
inconsistent as the facility was receiving the medication
during this time period in strip packaging, so it is unknown if
due to the packaging if the medication was just missed
being scanned as the medications were all together in one
package with small scanning codes on the package. No
other concerns noted in reviewing Youth S’s MAR.
7

• Youth B MAR for November 2023: Amphet/Dextr Tab 10
mg was documented as medication not available in
medication cart on 11/2 4pm dose, 11/3 8am dose, and
11/3 4pm does. It is unknown why this would not be in the
medication cart as Youth B had the medication before and
after these times. 11/23 4pm dose was blank. Risperidone
Tab 1 mg was documented as medication not available in

• Youth C MAR for November 2023: Loratadine Tab 10 mg is
documented as medication not available in medication cart
for 11/20, 11/21, 11/24, 11/25, 11/26, 11/27, 11/28, 11/29,
11/30. On 11/23 the MAR was left blank for the 4pm dose.
SM Allergy TAB 25 mg RFL was blank on 11/23 for 4pm
dose. No other concerns noted in reviewing Youth C’s
MAR.
• Youth D MAR for November 2023: Lithium was blank on
11/3, 11/6, 11/7, 11/10, 11/12 all for the 2pm doses. 11/22
and 11/24 12pm doses were blank. On 11/3 8pm dose,
11/18, and 11/26 it is documented the medication not
available in medication cart however it is unclear why as
the medication was available for doses in between these
dates and times. No other concerns noted in reviewing
Youth D’s MAR.
• Youth E, Youth F, Youth I, Youth J, and Youth N MARs for
November 2023: No concerns were noted in reviewing their
MARs.
• Youth G MAR for November 2023: Guanfacine Tab 1mg
ER at 12pm was left blank on the MAR on 11/22 and 11/24.
No other concerns noted in reviewing Youth F’s MAR.
• Youth H MAR for November 2023: Youth H’s Atomoxetine
CAP 25mg at 8am was discontinued per WHS Psychiatric
Evaluation dated 11/14/2023 however Youth H’s MAR
continued to have the medication listed. The MAR
documents on 11/16, 11/26, and 11/27 the medication
withheld per medical, 11/23 and 11/24 document
medication not available in medication cart. Per the MAR,
Youth H received Atomoxetine on 11/17, 11/18, 11/19,
11/20, 11/21, 11/22, 11/25, 11/28, 11/29, 11/30.
Guanfacine Tab 1mg ER was documented as medication
not available in medication cart on 11/23 and 11/24.
Loratadine Tab 10mg was documented as medication not
8

available in medication cart on 11/23 and 11/24. No other
concerns noted in reviewing Youth H’s MAR.
• Youth K MAR for November 2023: Polymyxin B/Sol
Trimethp was left blank for 2pm does on 11/7, 11/9, 11/10.
11/4 8am and 11/12 2pm doses were documented as
medication not available in medication cart however the
MAR shows Youth K receiving the medication before and
after these dates. Trazodone Tab 50 mg is documented as
medication not available in medication cart on 11/1, 11/2,
11/3. Oxcarbazepin Tab 150mg is documented as
medication not available in medication cart on 11/3 for 8pm
dose however Youth K’s MAR shows Youth K had the
medication on 11/3 at 8am and then again on 11/4 at 8am.
No other concerns noted in reviewing Youth K’s MAR.
• Youth L MAR for November 2023: Aripiprazole Tab 2 mg
11/25 8pm dose was blank. Benzoyl PER Liq 5% wash
11/25 8pm dose was blank. Vyvanse Cap 50 mg is
documented as medication not available in medication cart
on 11/12 and 11/13. No other concerns noted in reviewing
Youth L’s MAR.
• Youth M MAR for November 2023: Aripiprazole Tab 10 mg
11/10 8am dose was blank. Bismatrol chew 262 mg 11/10
was blank. Ferrous Sulf Tab 325 mg 11/10 8am dose was
blank. Tums/Calcium 500 mg Chew 11/10 was blank. On
11/8, 11/24, 11/26, 11/28, and 11/29 it was documented
medication not available in medication cart however it is
unclear why as the medication was dispensed in between
these dates and in the cart. Documentation from Nurse to
Administrator 2 was viewed documenting the medication is
being marked as medication not available in medication
cart however Nurse reported to Administrator 2 the
medication is in the medication cart. No other concerns
noted in reviewing Youth M’s MAR.
• Youth O MAR for November 2023: Hydroxyzpam Cap 25
mg 11/3 4pm, 11/5 4pm, 11/23 4pm doses were blank. No
other concerns noted in reviewing Youth O’s MAR.
• Youth P MAR for November 2023: Youth P was at the
hospital on 11/14 and his Clonidine, Risperidone, and
Trazodone medications were all left blank. No concerns
noted in reviewing Youth P’s MAR.
• Email documentation to Nurse from Pharmascript with the
Delivery Manifest showing Youth C’s Loratadine Tab 10mg
9

was delivered at the facility on 11/2/2023 and contained 30
pills.
• Email documentation from Nurse dated 11/27/2023
informing the facilities secretary who communicates with
Psychiatrist: Advanced Specialty RX does not have a
discontinue order for Youth H’s Atomoxetine.
• WHS Psychiatric Evaluation Update and Medications
Review dated 11/14/2023: Youth H is discontinued from
Atomoxetine.
• Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 personnel file: Staff 3, Staff 4,
and Staff 5 received Employee Counseling on 11/15/2023
for not passing Youth D’s medications. Staff 4 also had one
other discipline in their personnel file for something
unrelated to medications. Staff 3 received medication
training on 3/30/2023, 6/14/2023, 8/18/2023, 12/8/2023,
and 1/7/2024, Staff 4 on 3/30/2023, 6/14/2023, 8/18/2023,
12/8/2023, and 1/7/2024, and Staff 5 on 8/25/2023,
12/8/2023, and 1/7/2024. Staff 5 began passing
medications at the facility after his initial training on
8/25/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance. There are several youth
and dates where the MAR was left blank, and it is unknown if the
youth were provided their medications. There does not appear to
be an issue with the pharmacy supplying the medications however
there appears to be an internal issue with staff locating the
medications in the cart as there are several youth, on several
days, that indicate medication not available in cart however the
medication per the MAR were given on days and times in-between
when it is documented the medication is not available.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility update their internal policy and
procedure to provide clear direction for staff on coding medication
notes. It is recommended the facility addresses youth’s
medications that are discontinued be removed from the MAR on
the date of the medication is discontinued and removed from the
medication cart.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(g) Methods for dispensing medication when the resident will be
off site.
10

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth reported he was off grounds and did not return in time to
receive his medication.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024. Youth B reported there was one time he was on an off
grounds activity and did not return in time to receive his
medications in the time frame.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/12/2024. Staff 4
received discipline at the facility due to not passing Youth D’s 2pm
medication. Staff 4 passes medications at the facility when she
does not have a supervisor scheduled on shift. Staff 4 reported
Youth D was prescribed Lithium in the MAR for 12pm however in
the MAR it stated to provide the medication at 2pm. Staff 4
reported she was disciplined for not passing Youth D’s medication
on a few occasions, some where he was on campus and others
when Youth D was off grounds. Staff 4 could not recall
specifically where Youth D was off grounds when she forgot to
pass the medication. When youth are off grounds for planned
activities, Nurse is notified and will package the medications to be
sent with staff for youth to receive while on outings. Supervisors
can also take the medications with when youth are off grounds to
pass the medications. Staff 4 reported she did not take Youth D’s
medications with them when she was off grounds with Youth D to
pass his medication and that was included in her discipline.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams on 2/13/2024. Staff 5
reported if a youth is going to be off grounds on a facility outing
when medications are due to be passed, if there is a supervisor
going on the outing the supervisor will take the medication and
dispense the medication at the time the youth is prescribed to take
it. If it is within an hour window before or after the prescribed time,
the youth can receive the medication prior to going or after
returning to the facility if it falls in the timeframe. If the youth is off
grounds on a facility outing and there is no supervisor to pass the
medication or the youth does not return within the hour window to
have the medication, then staff enter “out of the facility” on the
MAR.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024
and via teams on 2/9/2024. Nurse reported when staff are taking
youth off grounds for outings, an email is sent with the youth that
will be going and Nurse checks to see if medications need to be
11

sent with the supervisor and sends the medications. When
medications are dispensed while on an outing, the MAR does not
reflect anything different, it just shows the medication was given.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024 and via telephone 2/6/2024. Administrator 1 reported
he was made aware of a few instances where youth were off
grounds, and the facility did not pack medications. Staff 4 was
disciplined for this occurring.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services (WHS) Medication Control
Administration Policy and Site Protocols Policy: The facility
policy does not address medication dispensing while youth
on on facility off ground activities.
• Email provided from the facility dated 2/7/2024 indicating
Youth D did not get his medication on 11/26/2023 due to
Youth D being on a facility outing and medications were not
sent on the outing to be given. Youth O was on a facility
outing on 11/23/2023 and medications were not sent on the
outing to be given.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 received Employee
Counseling on 11/15/2023 for not passing Youth D’s
medication. Staff 4 had one other discipline in their
personnel file unrelated to medications. Staff 4 received
medication training 6/4/2023 and 12/8/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 4 did not dispense
medications to Youth D while off grounds. Youth D did not receive
his medications while on an off-ground outing on 11/22/2023 and
11/24/2023, and Youth O on 11/23/2023 due to staff not
packaging the medication to dispense while off grounds. The
facility does not have a policy/procedure to address dispensing
medications while off grounds on facility activities.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility include policy/procedure to address
dispensing medications while on off ground outings, when youth
are AWOLP, and when youth are at the hospital.
Conclusion Violation Established
12

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
